perturbation.original_text:
All notices or other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given if delivered by receipted hand delivery or mailed by prepaid registered or certified mail (return receipt requested) or by recognized overnight courier addressed as follows:

If to Freedom Mortgage to:



Freedom Mortgage Company 907 Pleasant Valley Ave., Suite 3 Mount Laurel, New Jersey 08054 Attention: Chief Corporate Counsel

If to Cherry Hill to:



Cherry Hill Mortgage Investment Corp. 301 Harper Drive Moorestown, New Jersey 08057 Attention: Chief Financial Officer

or such other address as shall be furnished in writing by any Party. Any such notice or communication shall be deemed to have been given: (i) as of the date delivered by hand; (ii) three (3) Business Days after being delivered to the U.S. mail, postage prepaid; or (iii) one (1) Business Day after being delivered to the overnight courier.
perturbation.changed_text:
All notices or other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given if delivered by unreceipted hand delivery or mailed by standard mail (return receipt NOT requested) or by standard courier addressed as follows:

If to Freedom Mortgage to:



Freedom Mortgage Company 907 Pleasant Valley Ave., Suite 3 Mount Laurel, New Jersey 08054 Attention: Chief Corporate Counsel

If to Cherry Hill to:



Cherry Hill Mortgage Investment Corp. 301 Harper Drive Moorestown, New Jersey 08057 Attention: Chief Financial Officer

or such other address as shall be furnished in writing by any Party. Any such notice or communication shall be deemed to have been given: (i) as of the date delivered by hand; (ii) ten (10) Business Days after being delivered to the U.S. mail, postage prepaid; or (iii) five (5) Business Days after being delivered to the standard courier.
perturbation.explanation: This change increases the time frame for delivery and alters the form of mail. Increasing the time it takes to send legal communication, as well as not obtaining a return receipt, can affect a party's due process rights because critical notices might not be received or acknowledged promptly. This is not legally compliant and will likely be seen as a breach of contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Due Process Clause of the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments; General Contract Law Principles

perturbation.original_text: In the event that a party materially breaches any representation or covenant herein, the other party may give written notice of the breach requiring the same to be remedied within 30 days of receipt of such notice. If the breaching party fails to remedy the material breach in such time period, the non-breaching party may terminate this Agreement by delivery of a written termination notice to the breaching party. Any such termination shall not relieve the breaching party from any obligation or liability arising prior to such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that a party materially breaches any representation or covenant herein, the other party may give verbal notice of the breach requiring the same to be remedied within 10 days of such notice. If the breaching party fails to remedy the material breach in such time period, the non-breaching party may terminate this Agreement by immediate verbal notice to the breaching party. Any such termination shall relieve the breaching party from any obligation or liability arising prior to such termination.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the notice from 'written' to 'verbal' and reducing the cure period from 30 days to 10 days creates non-compliance with standard contract law practices. Verbal notices are difficult to prove, and a 10-day cure period might be unreasonably short for rectifying substantial breaches. Moreover, the immediate release of obligation and liability arising from a material breach upon termination is against general contract law because it is often not enforced and would need to be evaluated by the court.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles Regarding Notice and Cure Periods; Principles of Equity

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of New York, without giving effect to its principles of conflicts of laws, other than Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware, giving full effect to its principles of conflicts of laws, other than Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces the 'giving full effect' to its principles of conflicts of laws, which can lead to unpredictable outcomes regarding which state's laws actually apply. This is because conflicts of law principles determine which jurisdiction's laws govern when there are inconsistencies between the laws of different states. Changing this aspect introduces potential conflicts and ambiguities that could render the agreement unenforceable in certain situations. By adhering to the conflict of laws, it could create an even further contradiction in what law applies to the case, considering this is a New Jersey corporation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles; Conflicts of Law Principles
